title: Commending the Cypress Hills Local Development Corporation on the occasion of its Annual Meeting and Celebration of Community Progress on January 20, 2011 and recognizing the honorees of the evening
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  the Cypress Hills Local Development
Corporation upon the occasion of its Annual Meeting and  Celebration  of
Community  Progress  on January 20, 2011 and recognizing the honorees of
the evening

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize  and  pay
tribute  to  organizations  and  individuals  of high purpose and worthy
accomplishment whose endeavors have a significant impact on the lives of
others and the communities they serve; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern and fully in accord with its  long-
standing  traditions,  this  Legislative Body is justly proud to commend
the Cypress Hills Local Development Corporation upon the occasion of its
Annual Meeting and Celebration of Community Progress, to be held at  the
Cypress Hills-Fulton Street Senior Center on Thursday, January 20, 2011,
and to recognize the honorees of the evening; and
  WHEREAS,  Founded  in 1983, the Cypress Hills Local Development Corpo-
ration is a not-for-profit community organization  serving  8,000  resi-
dents a year through a comprehensive array of community service programs
and neighborhood development projects; and
  WHEREAS,  Each year at its Annual Meeting and Celebration of Community
Progress, the Cypress Hills Local Development Corporation  proudly  pays
tribute  to  those who have supported the Corporation and have helped to
further its mission and efforts; and
  WHEREAS, The Cypress Hills Local Development Corporation's 2011  hono-
rees  are:   Yvonne Cook, recipient of the Cypress Hills Board of Direc-
tors Lifetime Achievement Award; Michelle Denise Brown, recipient of the
Cypress Hills Distinguished Staff Service Award; The George  Walker  Jr.
Community  Coalition,  Inc.  and  its Executive Director Carolyn Walker-
Diallo, Esq. and Deputy Executive Director of Community  Affairs  Salema
Davis,  recipients of the Cypress Hills Community Hero Award; Dennis and
Nancy Moore, recipients of The Cypress  Hills  Neighborhood  Improvement
and  Beautification  Award;  and  Jorel  Moore, recipient of the Cypress
Hills Young Activist Award; and
  WHEREAS, In so effectively and creatively serving  the  Cypress  Hills
community,  the  Cypress  Hills Local Development Corporation has estab-
lished itself as a preeminent organization dedicated  to  enhancing  and
improving  the  community and justly merits the recognition and appreci-
ation of this Legislative Body; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commend  the  Cypress Hills Local Development Corporation upon the occa-
sion of its Annual Meeting and  Celebration  of  Community  Progress  on
January  20,  2011 and to applaud the honorees of the evening; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the Cypress Hills Local Development Corporation  and  to  the
honorees of the evening.
